prompt:
<s>### Instruction: Your role is to choose the corresponding function to answer the user query. You will be given a history of your previous actions and several other information in the input.
### Input:
Your goal is to You're a tabloid journalist, write a report about the paper, for the general public.
To achieve this goal you will make good use of the following functions:
- final_answer(your_final_answer: str) -> str ; final_answer your final answer to the user
- metadata(document_path: str) -> str ; metadata returns metadata about the document (type, number of pages, chunks, letters etc.)
- read_document(document_path: str) -> str ; read_document will return the content of the document
- read_chunk(document_path: str, chunk_number: int) -> str ; read_chunk will return the content of a document chunk (index starts at 0)
- journalist(subject: str, style: str, length: str, language: str) -> str ; journalist will write a news report with great skill about any subject

Note: You will not make use of composite functions.
The following are the files you can work with. Always write their full path.
- papers/papiers/4.pdf

- Action 1: metadata

ABSTRACT
In recent years, there has been a explosion in the amount of text
data from a variety of sources. This volume of text isan invaluable
source of information and knowledge which needs to be effectively
summarized to be useful. In this review, the main approaches to
automatic text summarization are described. We review the differ-
ent processes for summarization and describe the effectiveness and
shortcomings of the different methods

- Action 3: journalist
Arguments: ['explosion of text data and automatic summarization techniques', 'sensational', 'short', 'English']
Output: **"Data Tsunami Unleashed: AI Summarization Tech to the Rescue!"**

In an unprecedented digital deluge, the world is drowning in an ocean of text! Every second, humanity generates enough words to fill a library of Babel, and the surge shows no signs of slowing. But fear not, for a savior emerges from the silicon: Automatic Summarization Techniques!

These cutting-edge algorithms are our digital David against the Goliath of information overload. With the power to distill vast epics into digestible nuggets, they promise to keep us afloat in the relentless tide of data. Imagine the entirety of "War and Peace" reduced to a tweet, or the day's news crunched into a bite-sized snack—this is no longer the stuff of science fiction!

As we stand on the brink of a new era, where every keystroke adds to the textual tempest, these AI-powered marvels work tirelessly. They parse, they analyze, they synthesize, transforming the chaotic cacophony of the internet into a symphony of succinctness.

Prepare to witness the revolution of reading, as automatic summarization techniques redefine knowledge consumption. The explosion of text data has met its match, and the future of information is here, concise and clear. Hold on to your hats, readers, for the age of information inundation is over, and the dawn of distilled data is upon us!

---
You will now answer with an action (using a function) by precisely following this template :

Explaination: Replace this text with your reasoning behind your action choice.
Action: function(argument1, ...)

### Response:
Explanation: The previous actions have provided metadata about the document and a sensationalized news report based on the topic of text data explosion and automatic summarization techniques. To further enhance the report and provide more detailed information to the readers, I will now read another chunk of the document. This will allow me to gather more specific details or interesting points that can be included in the tabloid article to make it more engaging and informative for the general public.

Action: read_chunk('/papers/papiers/4.pdf', 1)</s>
